pain_points: Fraud detection models retrained monthly — too slow for emerging patterns
Data science team of 12 spending 60% of time on infrastructure instead of modeling
No standardized model deployment pipeline — each team rolls their own
prospects.recent_news: Closed Series C ($85M) in January 2026 with plans to triple ML team headcount
prospects.description: DataPulse Analytics provides real-time transaction monitoring and fraud scoring for mid-market banks. Their ML pipeline handles 2M+ transactions daily but retraining cycles lag behind new fraud vectors. The engineering org is growing fast post-Series C and looking to standardize their MLOps stack before the team triples in size.

pain_points: Clinical NLP models stuck in research — no path to production deployment
HIPAA compliance requirements making ML infrastructure decisions slow
Single ML engineer supporting 5 different research projects
prospects.recent_news: Hired first Chief AI Officer in November 2025, signaling serious ML investment
prospects.description: MedVault Health runs a network of 30+ specialty clinics and is sitting on a decade of structured clinical data. Their research team has promising NLP models for clinical note summarization and diagnostic support, but nothing has made it past Jupyter notebooks. The new CAIO hire signals executive buy-in, but they need infrastructure to move from experiments to deployed models.

pain_points: Recommendation engine latency spikes during flash sales (p99 hits 800ms)
Model versioning is manual — rollbacks take hours instead of minutes
A/B testing new models requires engineering tickets and 2-week lead time
prospects.recent_news: Q4 2025 revenue up 40% YoY driven by AI-powered personalization features
prospects.description: ShopStream operates a mid-market e-commerce platform with 15M monthly active users. Their ML team of 25 has built sophisticated recommendation and search ranking models, but the serving infrastructure can't keep up during peak traffic. They've outgrown Kubeflow and need a platform that handles model versioning, canary deployments, and auto-scaling without the team maintaining it all.

pain_points: Predictive maintenance models exist as Excel spreadsheets, not deployed systems
Factory floor sensor data collected but unused — 50TB sitting in S3
No ML team — quality engineers doing data science part-time
prospects.recent_news: Board approved $5M digital transformation budget for 2026, specifically mentioning AI/ML
prospects.description: PrecisionWorks runs 8 manufacturing plants producing precision components for aerospace and automotive. They have 2 years of sensor data from 200+ machines but no real ML capability. Quality engineers built some predictive models in Excel that actually work, which convinced the board to fund a proper ML initiative. They need a platform that non-ML-engineers can use to deploy and monitor models.

pain_points: Claims processing models have 15% false positive rate — too many manual reviews
Regulatory requirements demand model explainability but current tools are inadequate
Model drift detection is reactive — they find out models degraded from business metrics, not monitoring
prospects.recent_news: Announced AWS migration in December 2025, moving all workloads from Azure by Q3 2026
prospects.description: ClearPath Insurance processes 500K claims annually using ML-based fraud detection and automated routing. Their models work but lack the explainability regulators are demanding. They're in the middle of a cloud migration from Azure to AWS, which is the perfect time to re-platform their ML stack. MLflow on Databricks has been their primary tool, but they're open to AWS-native alternatives.

pain_points: Demand forecasting models accurate to ±8% but business needs ±3%
Solar and wind generation prediction models not accounting for microclimate data
Data pipeline from 10K+ smart meters breaks weekly
prospects.recent_news: Won $30M DOE grant for smart grid AI research in October 2025
prospects.description: GridWise manages power distribution for 2M customers across 3 states. They're integrating more renewable sources and need better demand and generation forecasting. Their existing TensorFlow models are decent but plateau'd at ±8% accuracy. The DOE grant gives them budget and mandate to push AI capabilities significantly forward, but their team of 8 data scientists is already stretched thin.

pain_points: Contract review models trained on US law only — expanding to UK/EU requires retraining
GPU costs for fine-tuning LLMs eating 40% of cloud budget
No way to A/B test prompt strategies in production
prospects.recent_news: Launched GPT-powered contract summarizer in September 2025, hit 10K users in 8 weeks
prospects.description: LexicAI builds AI tools for corporate legal teams — contract review, clause extraction, risk flagging. They've had early success with LLM-based features but the GPU bill is growing faster than revenue. They fine-tune open-source models on p4d instances, which costs $25K/month. They need a platform that can reduce fine-tuning costs and let them experiment with prompt strategies without redeploying.

pain_points: Route optimization still rule-based — not using ML despite having GPS data from 2K vehicles
Demand forecasting done quarterly in spreadsheets by regional managers
IT department resistant to cloud-based ML — security concerns with shipment data
prospects.recent_news: New CTO joined from Amazon in February 2026, pushing cloud-first strategy
prospects.description: TerraVision is a national logistics company with 2000+ delivery vehicles and 50 distribution centers. They have years of GPS, delivery time, and demand data locked in on-prem Oracle databases. The new CTO (ex-Amazon) is pushing aggressively to move to AWS and start using ML for route optimization and demand forecasting. The biggest blocker is the IT security team's concerns about shipment data in the cloud.

pain_points: FDA-cleared radiology models need continuous monitoring but no MLOps in place
Model retraining requires 3 months due to regulatory validation requirements
Deploying models across 50 hospital sites means managing 50 different environments
prospects.recent_news: Received FDA 510(k) clearance for lung nodule detection model in December 2025
prospects.description: PixelHealth builds AI-powered radiology tools that are deployed in hospital PACS systems. Their lung nodule detection model just got FDA clearance, which means they now need production-grade MLOps — model versioning, drift detection, audit trails, and multi-site deployment. They're a small team that's been focused on model accuracy, not infrastructure, and they need to scale fast before competitors catch up.

trends: Real-time ML inference for fraud detection
pain_points: Model latency requirements under 100ms
Audit trails for every prediction
Data sovereignty across jurisdictions
talking_points: Reduce fraud detection retraining from months to days

pain_points: HIPAA-compliant ML infrastructure
Long regulatory approval cycles
Small labeled datasets
talking_points: Model versioning with full audit history
Transfer learning to work with small medical datasets

pain_points: Latency during traffic spikes
Model version management across regions
A/B testing infrastructure
talking_points: Auto-scaling inference to handle flash sales
Built-in A/B testing for model versions

pain_points: Bridging OT and IT data systems
ML skills gap in engineering teams
Edge deployment for factory floor
talking_points: No-code model deployment for engineering teams

pain_points: Model explainability for regulators
Drift detection for underwriting models
Legacy system integration
talking_points: REST API integration with any claims system

pain_points: Time-series model accuracy
Real-time processing from IoT devices
Model accuracy under distribution shift
Fine-tuning costs for domain-specific LLMs
Multi-jurisdiction model management
Prompt engineering at scale
talking_points: Multi-model routing to cut inference costs

pain_points: On-prem to cloud migration for ML
Real-time optimization with legacy systems
Data security for shipment information
talking_points: Secure VPC deployment for sensitive data
Hybrid cloud support for gradual migration
Pre-built connectors for SAP and Oracle

trends: Continuous model monitoring for regulatory compliance
pain_points: Multi-site model deployment consistency
Regulatory audit requirements
Model retraining with small labeled datasets
talking_points: Regulatory-grade model versioning and audit trails
Automated monitoring dashboards for FDA post-market requirements
